org.tigris.noodle
Class ProxyModule

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.tigris.noodle.ProxyModule
public class ProxyModule
extends java.lang.Object

Proxy a request for Noodle. This is the core class for Noodle; it does the actual proxying of the request.

Version:
$Id: ProxyModule.html,v 1.5 2003/05/01 22:24:10 edk Exp $
Author:
Jon S. Stevens, St.Ack, Ed Korthof

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ProxyModule getInstance()
Get the singleton -- the default proxy module.

proxyRequest

public static final void proxyRequest(NoodleData noodleData)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. use getInstance(), instanciate a new ProxyModule, or instanciate a ProxyModule subclass and use the instance method.

Proxy a request. This is the meat of everything. It does the proxy of the request including applying the pre/post filters when necessary.
Parameters:
noodleData - Noodle Data. Has what we need to make the request and its in here that we put the the request results.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception -  
See Also:
proxyRequest(NoodleData, String)

proxyRequest

public final void proxyRequest(NoodleData noodleData,
                               java.lang.String inSavedOffQuery)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Proxy a request. This is the meat of everything. It does the proxy of the request including applying the pre/post filters when necessary.
Parameters:
noodleData - Noodle Data. Has what we need to make the request and its in here that we put the the request results.
inSavedOffQuery - req.getQueryString can return a null query string in circumstance where not logged in to Helm. If the caller has squirreled away the original query, pass it here. May be null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception -  

proxyRequestMethod

protected HTTPClient.HTTPResponse proxyRequestMethod(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest inRequest,
                                                     java.net.URL inURL,
                                                     java.lang.String inProxyURI,
                                                     HTTPClient.NVPair[] inHeaders2Send,
                                                     byte[] inPostData)
                                              throws java.net.ProtocolException,
                                                     java.io.IOException,
                                                     HTTPClient.ModuleException
Do the actual proxy w/ appropriate method (GET, POST, etc.).
Parameters:
inRequest - The servlet request object.
inURL - Basic url w/ host and port information. Used to set up the HTTPClient connection.
inProxyURI - File we're to request along w/ whats left of query string after stripping page to request (If any).
inHeaders2Send - HTTP headers to send on the proxy request.
inPostData - Data to use w/ POST requests, if thats what we're doing here.
Returns:
A HTTPClient HTTPResponse object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException -  
HTTPClient.ModuleException -  
java.net.ProtocolException - If we get a method request that we do not support.

getQueryString

protected java.lang.String getQueryString(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest inRequest,
                                          java.lang.String inSavedOffQuery)
                                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Get the query string. inRequest.getQueryString() can return null. Put in check for null and use alternate query string source, if one supplied.
Parameters:
inRequest - Our incoming request.
Returns:
The query string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Throw NPE if we can't get query string.

getValueFromQueryString

protected java.lang.String getValueFromQueryString(java.lang.String inKey,
                                                   java.lang.String inQueryStr)
                                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Get value from the passed in query string.
Parameters:
inKey - Key we use pulling value from inQueryStr.
inQueryStr - Query string to pull value on the end of inKey from.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If we can't find inKey value in passed string.

stripQueryString

public final java.lang.String stripQueryString(java.lang.String inQueryString,
                                               java.lang.String inKey)
Strip key and its value from the querystring.
Parameters:
inQueryString - Query string.
Returns:
New query string absent 'page=VALUE'.

value - Protocol to parse.
Returns:

readFully

public static byte[] readFully(java.io.InputStream is)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Read all data from stream even if total length is unknown. Reads 4096 bytes at a time.
Parameters:
is - Stream to read from.
Returns:
Byte array of all read from stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException -
